questions.text: A 26-year-old football player came with a history of falling on outstretched hands while playing. His X-ray shows which of the following dislocation?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Galeazzi fracture-dislocation Galeazzi fracture is a distal third radial shaft fracture with an associated distal radioulnar joint (DRUJ) injury . Diagnosis can be suspected with a distal radius fracture with the widening of the radioulnar joint on AP wrist radiographs and volar/dorsal subluxation of the radioulnar joint on lateral wrist radiographs.

Highyeild:

GALEAZZI FRACTURE-DISLOCATION This injury is the counterpart of the Monteggia fracture-dislocation. Here, there is a fracture of the lower third of the radius with dislocation or subluxation of the distal radio-ulnar joint. It commonly results from a fall on an out stretched hand. DISPLACEMENT The radius fracture is angulated medially and anteriorly (Fig-15.4). The distal radio-ulnar joint is disrupted, resulting in dorsal dislocation of the distal end of the ulna. DIAGNOSIS In an isolated fracture of the distal-half of the radius, the distal radio-ulnar joint must be carefully evaluated for subluxation or dislocation. TREATMENT Perfect reduction is essential for complete restora- tion of functions, particularly rotation of the fore- arm. It is difficult to achieve and maintain perfect reduction by conservative methods (except in children). Most adults require open reduction and internal fixation of the radius with a plate. The dislocated radio-ulnar joint may automatically fall back in place or may require open reduction. COMPLICATIONS Malunion occurs because of displacement of the fragment. It results in deformity and limitation of supination and pronation.

Random:

Explanation For incorrect options:- < Option: B. Monteggia fracture-dislocations consist of a fracture of the ulnar shaft with concomitant dislocation of the radial head as the result of a fall onto an outstretched hand (FOOSH). Option: C. Essex-Lopresti fracture- dislocation is characterized by a fracture of the radial head, dislocation of the distal radioulnar joint, and rupture of the interosseous membrane . Option: D. Barton fractures are intra-articular fractures of the distal radius . It may be dorsal or volar type.

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy had an injury to his right index finger while playing cricket. He was asked to use a splint as shown below. The boy must have been diagnosed with:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mallet finger Mallet Finge r is a finger deformity caused by disruption of the terminal extensor tendon distal to the DIP Diagnosis is made clinically with a presence of a distal phalanx at about 45° of flexion with a lack of active DIP extension. Treatment is usually extension splinting of the DIP joint for 6-8 weeks.

Highyeild:

Mallet finger (Baseball finger) results from the sudden passive flexion of the distal interphalangeal joint so that the extensor tendon of the distal inter- phalangeal (DIP) joint is avulsed from its insertion at the base of the distal phalanx. Sometimes it takes a fragment of bone with it. Clinically, distal phalanx is in slight flexion. Treatment is by immobilising the DIP joint in hyperextension with the help of an aluminium splint or plaster cast.

Option: C. extension splint not used in DIP joint dislocation. Option: D. extension splint not used in phalanx fracture

questions.text: A 40-year-old lorry driver had an RTA and deceleration injury. A CT scan of the cervical spine was taken and a cut section is shown below. Name this injury.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Jefferson’s fracture Jefferson fracture is the burst fracture of the atlas. A Jefferson fracture is a bone fracture of the vertebra C1 . The vertebra C1 is a bony ring, with two wedge-shaped lateral masses , connected by relatively thin anterior and posterior arches and a transverse ligament.

Highyeild:

Jefferson’s fracture: Fracture of the first cervical vertebra.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B. Hangman’s fracture is a bilateral fracture traversing the pars interarticularis of cervical vertebrae 2 (C2) with an associated traumatic subluxation of C2 on cervical vertebrae 3 (C3). It is the second most common fracture of the C2 vertebrae following a fracture of the odontoid process. Option: C. Clay-shoveler fractures are fractures of the spinous process of a lower cervical vertebra (C7/T1). Option: D. Chance fracture is an unstable spine fracture that typically occurs at the thoracolumbar junction. It is a horizontal fracture extending from posterior to anterior through the spinous process, pedicles, and vertebral body.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Jones fracture A Jones fracture is a broken bone in a specific part of the fifth metatarsal of the foot between the base and middle part Option: C. Lisfranc fracture: A Lisfranc fracture is a tarsometatarsa l fracture-dislocation characterized by traumatic disruption between the articulation of the medial cuneiform and base of the second metatarsal. Diagnosis is confirmed by radiographs which may show a widening of the interval between the 1st and 2nd ray. Treatment is generally operative with either ORIF or arthrodesis. Option: D. Osteoporotic fractures are a result of osteoporosis, a condition in which the bones become more fragile due to bone deterioration or low bone mass. Weaker bones are at greater risk for fractures.

questions.text: A car driver was diagnosed with a talus fracture of the right ankle following a road traffic accident. All these are eponyms of talus fracture except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lover’s fracture Option: C. Lovers/Don Juan fracture is a fracture of the calcaneum. All others are types of talus fractures.

Highyeild:

"Lover's fracture" "Don joun fracture" Jumper's fracture fracture of the calcaneus and a dorso-lumbar spine fracture. This is called a 'jumpers fracture or a 'lover's fracture, because it is usually seen in people jumping out of a window to escape from the police or a jealous husband.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Aviator fracture: Fracture of the neck of the talus resulting from forced dorsiflexion of the ankle Option: B. Fractures of the lateral tubercle of the posterior process are known as Shepherd's fracture Option: D. Snowboard’s fracture - fracture of the lateral process of the talus. Lovers/Don Juan fracture is a fracture of the calcaneum.
